cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles ESE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northwest today along the Florida east coast, then accelerate north-northeast Monday–Tuesday skirting Georgia and making landfall near the South/North Carolina border before continuing through the Mid-Atlantic toward New England.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast near the South Carolina / North Carolina border

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of South Santee River SC to Surf City NC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach FL to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East Coast from Florida northward through the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic, and New England
weather_observation.wind: Peak tropical-storm-force winds possible Tuesday night into early Wednesday with gusts 40–50 mph; overall chance of 34 kt winds 25%, 50 kt winds 2%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation anticipated in the upper Chesapeake Bay; minor tidal anomalies possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–5 inches with locally up to 7 inches; risk of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands; dangerous marine conditions on the Chesapeake Bay and approaches.
